page.title: 05SULLY ISLAND
page.content: Sully Island is in Swanbridge Bay,in the Bristol Channel.It is a small island and on rough days the tide washes over the top. Sully Island has an Iron Age fort occupying the eastern end of the island, on the summit of which is a bronze age barrow. Sully Island is about 500 metres from the mainland, Swanbridge. It is joined by a causeway. When the tide is out people can walk across to the island, but when the tide is in you can't cross. The current is very strong and many people have been trapped on the island. On the island there is a lot of grass and bushes, but on the other side there are lots of caves and rocks.
